      • PROOF_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String PROOF_ENABLED
        A flag to enable asset proof that is used to verify assets (false by default). This feature must be enabled in both client and server.
        See Also:

        public static final java.lang.String PROOF_PRIVATE_KEY_PEM
        Required if scalar.dl.ledger.proof.enabled is true and scalar.dl.ledger.proof.private_key_path is empty. PEM-encoded private key data.

      • ORDERING_ENABLED

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String ORDERING_ENABLED
        Deprecated. 
        A flag to use ordering for better tamper-evidence (false by default). Ordering feature is deprecated and will be removed in release 4.0.0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXECUTABLE_CONTRACTS

        public static final java.lang.String EXECUTABLE_CONTRACTS
        Binary names of contracts that can be executed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIRECT_ASSET_ACCESS_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String DIRECT_ASSET_ACCESS_ENABLED
        A flag to access asset table directly without going through asset_metadata (false by default). This should be set to false for some databases such as Cassandra that incur multiple database lookups for scanning a clustering key with limit 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TX_STATE_MANAGEMENT_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String TX_STATE_MANAGEMENT_ENABLED
        A flag to manage transaction states by Ledger (false by default). This must be enabled when using JdbcTransactionManager as the transaction manager of Scalar DB.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ASSET_INPUT_DATA_PRESERVATION_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String ASSET_INPUT_DATA_PRESERVATION_ENABLED
        A flag to preserve the data in the input dependencies of each asset (true by default). This has to be set to true if you use only Ledger because Ledger uses the data of input dependencies to validate assets. This can be set to false if you use Auditor to reduce storage consumption and processing cost for the data, but in such a case, the corresponding configuration of Auditor has to be set to the same value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
